name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"76ccd3d0-4dd6-4e95-8231-741ff48e3be4","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Scope Lifecycle & Initialization","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f5266653-5c91-49d7-8e2d-3226607b51dc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods handles the "Birth and Structure" phase of the analysis. Before the framework can track data flow or logic, it must first map out the architectural skeleton of the source code. These methods are responsible for turning raw strings of code into a nested hierarchy of environments.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"99d426d4-5286-4adb-9f06-59bbcbc477eb","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"495fc6d9-4791-49e7-a9bc-0aa17b03145b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Functional Purpose","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"aba0695b-5c9e-428b-bf22-fc6c14ef2627","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary goal of this group is to establish ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Environmental Context","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In Python, code is organized into a tree (Modules → Classes → Methods → Nested Functions). These methods ensure that the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mirrors this tree exactly, providing a foundation for name resolution and variable isolation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0f5fca3e-356b-439e-b0e7-65216a42a22d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"704504db-f347-4200-9ad2-ba3f652b9248","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method Details","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7c4c24de-9618-4c07-9ba2-c6d440049e23","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instance. It sets up the primary storage dictionary (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") which maps namespaces to their respective ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects, and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"copySeq","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" tracker used for versioning scopes during complex analysis paths.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a638003-2b15-4d23-929a-195ddddb0aab","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"handle_module
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The most critical method for initial ingestion. It takes the module name, filename, and the actual source code as input. By utilizing the Python ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"symtable","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" library, it performs a recursive pass over the code to identify every function and class. It builds the initial "Parent-Child" relationships between scopes, ensuring that the hierarchy is ready before the detailed analysis begins.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6a176c10-0ef5-4e23-8c66-fb6e0f3a5965","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"create_scope
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The standard internal factory for generating ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects. It checks if a scope for a specific namespace already exists; if not, it creates a new one and links it to its parent. This is the primary way new logical blocks are registered in the system.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c9bc0b9b-c9b2-4e15-b917-3317f36f491a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"create_scope_by_name
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A specialized variation of scope creation. It allows the system to register a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" under a specific alias or dictionary key (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") that may differ from its literal namespace. This is particularly useful for handling dynamic or synthetic code structures that require unique tracking identifiers.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1e38a397-857c-4863-9733-18fd927816b6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_scope
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Provides a mechanism to manually inject an existing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" into the manager’s registry. It explicitly sets the item's parent, allowing the framework to reorganize or manually construct scope relationships that may not be immediately apparent through standard AST traversal.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b4a0ae13-82ad-482c-aa92-36413fabb31f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"7d4a2649-8cf3-43ca-b135-97d7cca9922b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why This Group Matters","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bb473c97-17e1-4163-952b-5cfc0ca7f9b1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Without these methods, the analyzer would have no concept of "where" it is. By establishing the scope hierarchy upfront:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"60349d89-61ed-4000-99d4-e8defd96628d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Isolation is guaranteed","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Variables in one function won't accidentally overwrite variables in another.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a6ffcdfa-5fb1-4c5c-91ae-bc2487e5bea9","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Navigation is possible","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The analyzer can "look up" from a function to its containing class to find shared attributes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"810b8a9e-2449-43c9-b4a1-2f1f102a7466","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Efficiency is increased","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By pre-calculating the list of functions and classes in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"handle_module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer can optimize how it visits different parts of the code.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7fde28b7-1542-47f0-8e1f-fa211b9b1c7b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
